result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler T Burkhalter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment & comm service.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No presence at Farm & Fleet, S. Stoughton Rd Madison. No weapons, ammunition or presence at shooting ranges.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: 10 hrs per wk until he finds employment.

Reporter: Lori Gerlach
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed. Defendant advised of right to and waived. Court accepted waiver of preliminary hearing. Court ordered case bound over to Branch 2. Bail continued.
Status conference on May 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 7, 2014 at 10:30 am.

- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring. Cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $5,000.00 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not be at any and all Pay Day Loan Stores
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not be at any and all Farm and Fleet Stores
- Defendant shall not be at any and all Pawn and/or Re-sale Stores
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 10:30 am.
